intro: Crudia harmsiana var. harmsiana, commonly known as the Harms' wild tea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
